newsitem.title: JORDAN: Netanyahu adviser flies to Jordan to meet king.
newsitem.headline: Netanyahu adviser flies to Jordan to meet king.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's political adviser Dore Gold flew to Amman on Sunday for talks with Jordan's King Hussein on the Middle East peace process, a Jordanian government official said.
The official said the talks would cover stalled PLO-Israeli talks over Palestinian self-rule and Israeli settlement expansion in the West Bank.
"The issue of settlements is of great concern to us," the official said.
King Hussein and Gold would also discuss bilateral issues stemming from the 1994 Jordan-Israeli peace treaty, including implementation of a trade accord.
Jordan says the level of trade, particularly between Jordan and the West Bank, remains well below levels anticipated in the agreement.
Netanyahu's office said the king sent a helicopter to Jerusalem to pick up Gold, who would return to Israel before the start of the Jewish holy day Yom Kippur at sunset.

Israel's late prime minister Yitzhak Rabin in 1994 signed a peace treaty with Jordan, which of all of Israel's Arab peace partners has maintained the closest relations with Netanyahu's right-wing government since its election in May.
